# Terraform Generator

## Overview
Generate Terraform configurations for infrastructure as code.

## Activation
Activates when user mentions "terraform", "infrastructure as code", "IaC", or "cloud resources".

## Instructions

1. Determine cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure)
2. Identify resources needed
3. Generate with:
   - Variables for flexibility
   - Outputs for important values
   - Proper resource naming
   - Tags/labels

## Examples

**Input:** "terraform for AWS EC2 with RDS"

**Output:**
```hcl
# variables.tf
variable "environment" {
  default = "production"
}

variable "instance_type" {
  default = "t3.micro"
}

# main.tf
provider "aws" {
  region = "us-east-1"
}

resource "aws_instance" "app" {
  ami           = "ami-0c55b159cbfafe1f0"
  instance_type = var.instance_type

  vpc_security_group_ids = [aws_security_group.app.id]

  tags = {
    Name        = "app-${var.environment}"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

resource "aws_db_instance" "main" {
  identifier        = "myapp-${var.environment}"
  engine            = "postgres"
  engine_version    = "15"
  instance_class    = "db.t3.micro"
  allocated_storage = 20

  db_name  = "myapp"
  username = "admin"
  password = var.db_password

  skip_final_snapshot = var.environment != "production"
}

# outputs.tf
output "instance_ip" {
  value = aws_instance.app.public_ip
}

output "rds_endpoint" {
  value = aws_db_instance.main.endpoint
}
```
